fields.name: fileName
fields.description:
Default filename for storing the body part if the receiving agent wishes to store it in an external
file

fields.name: disposition
fields.description: Indicates how the body part should be presented (`inline`, `attachment`, or as `form-data`)

fields.name: name
fields.description: Represents the field name in case of `multipart/form-data`

fields.name: parameters
fields.description: A set of parameters specified in the `attribute=value` notation

returnParameters.description: The `string` representation of the `ContentDisposition` object

methods.name: toString
methods.description:
Converts the `ContentDisposition` type to a string suitable to use as the value of a corresponding MIME header.
```ballerina
string contDisposition = contentDisposition.toString();
```

returnParameters.description: The `string` representation of the `ContentDisposition` object

otherMethods.name: toString
otherMethods.description:
Converts the `ContentDisposition` type to a string suitable to use as the value of a corresponding MIME header.
```ballerina
string contDisposition = contentDisposition.toString();
```

parameters.name: mediaType
parameters.description: Content type, which needs to be set to the entity

returnParameters.description: `()` if successful or else an `mime:InvalidContentTypeError` in case of invalid media-type

methods.name: setContentType
methods.description:
Sets the content-type to the entity.
```ballerina
mime:InvalidContentTypeError? contentType = mimeEntity.setContentType("application/json");
```

returnParameters.description: Content type as a `string`

methods.name: getContentType
methods.description:
Gets the content type of the entity.
```ballerina
string contentType = mimeEntity.getContentType();
```

parameters.name: contentId
parameters.description: Content ID, which needs to be set to the entity

methods.name: setContentId
methods.description:
Sets the content ID of the entity.
```ballerina
mimeEntity.setContentId("test-id");
```

returnParameters.description: Content ID as a `string`

methods.name: getContentId
methods.description:
Gets the content ID of the entity.
```ballerina
string contentId = mimeEntity.getContentId();
```

parameters.name: contentLength
parameters.description: Content length, which needs to be set to the entity

methods.name: setContentLength
methods.description:
Sets the content length of the entity.
```ballerina
mimeEntity.setContentLength(45555);
```

returnParameters.description: Content length as an `int` or else an error in case of a failure

methods.name: getContentLength
methods.description:
Gets the content length of the entity.
```ballerina
int|error contentLength = mimeEntity.getContentLength();
```

parameters.name: contentDisposition
parameters.description: Content disposition, which needs to be set to the entity

methods.name: setContentDisposition
methods.description:
Sets the content disposition of the entity.
```ballerina
mimeEntity.setContentDisposition(contentDisposition);
```

returnParameters.description: A `ContentDisposition` object

methods.name: getContentDisposition
methods.description:
Gets the content disposition of the entity.
```ballerina
mime:ContentDisposition contentDisposition = mimeEntity.getContentDisposition();
```

parameters.name: entityBody
parameters.description: Entity body can be of the type `string`,`xml`,`json`,`byte[]`,`Entity[]`, or `stream<byte[], io:Error?>`

methods.name: setBody
methods.description:
Sets the body of the entity with the given content. Note that any string value is set as `text/plain`. To send a
JSON-compatible string, set the content-type header to `application/json` or use the `setJsonPayload` method instead.
```ballerina
mimeEntity.setBody("body string");
```

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Path of the file

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Content type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The default value is `application/octet-stream`

methods.name: setFileAsEntityBody
methods.description:
Sets the entity body with a given file. This method overrides any existing `content-type` headers
with the default content-type, which is `application/octet-stream`. This default value
can be overridden by passing the content type as an optional parameter.
```ballerina
mimeEntity.setFileAsEntityBody("<file path>");
```

parameters.name: jsonContent
parameters.description: JSON content, which needs to be set to the entity

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Content type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The default value is `application/json`

methods.name: setJson
methods.description:
Sets the entity body with the given `json` content. This method overrides any existing `content-type` headers
with the default content-type, which is `application/json`. This default value can be overridden
by passing the content type as an optional parameter.
```ballerina
mimeEntity.setJson({ "Hello": "World" });
```

returnParameters.description: `json` data extracted from the entity body or else an `mime:ParserError` if the entity body is not a JSON

methods.name: getJson
methods.description:
Extracts the JSON body from the entity.
```ballerina
json|mime:ParserError result = entity.getJson();
```

parameters.name: xmlContent
parameters.description: XML content, which needs to be set to the entity

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Content type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The default value is `application/xml`

methods.name: setXml
methods.description:
Sets the entity body with the given XML content. This method overrides any existing content-type headers
with the default content-type, which is `application/xml`. This default value can be overridden
by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.
```ballerina
mimeEntity.setXml(xml `<hello> world </hello>`);
```

returnParameters.description: `xml` data extracted from the entity body or else an `mime:ParserError` if the entity body is not an XML

methods.name: getXml
methods.description:
Extracts the `xml` body from the entity.
```ballerina
xml|mime:ParserError result = entity.getXml();
```

parameters.name: textContent
parameters.description: Text content, which needs to be set to the entity

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Content type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The default value is `text/plain`

methods.name: setText
methods.description:
Sets the entity body with the given text content. This method overrides any existing content-type headers
with the default content-type, which is `text/plain`. This default value can be overridden
by passing the content type as an optional parameter.
```ballerina
mimeEntity.setText("Hello World");
```

returnParameters.description:
`string` data extracted from the the entity body or else an `mime:ParserError` if the entity body is not
text compatible

methods.name: getText
methods.description:
Extracts the text body from the entity. If the entity body is not text compatible, an error is returned.
```ballerina
string|mime:ParserError result = entity.getText();
```

parameters.name: blobContent
parameters.description: `byte[]` content that needs to be set to the entity

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Content type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The default value is `application/octet-stream`

methods.name: setByteArray
methods.description:
Sets the entity body with the given byte[] content. This method overrides any existing `content-type` headers
with the default content-type, which is `application/octet-stream`. This default value
can be overridden by passing the content type as an optional parameter.
```ballerina
entity.setByteArray(content.toBytes());
```

returnParameters.description:
`byte[]` data extracted from the the entity body or else a `mime:ParserError` in case of
errors

methods.name: getByteArray
methods.description:
Gets the entity body as a `byte[]` from a given entity. If the entity size is considerably large, consider
using the `getByteStream()` method instead.
```ballerina
byte[]|mime:ParserError result = entity.getByteArray();
```

parameters.name: byteStream
parameters.description: Byte stream, which needs to be set to the entity

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Content-type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

methods.name: setByteStream
methods.description:
Sets the entity body with the given byte stream content. This method overrides any existing content-type headers
with the default content-type, which is `application/octet-stream`. This default value
can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.
```ballerina
entity.setByteStream(byteStream);
```

parameters.name: arraySize
parameters.description: A defaultable parameter to state the size of the byte array. The default size is 8KB

returnParameters.description: A byte stream from which the payload can be read or `mime:ParserError` in case of errors

methods.name: getByteStream
methods.description:
Gets the entity body as a stream of `byte[]` from a given entity.
```ballerina
stream<byte[], io:Error?>|mime:ParserError str = entity.getByteStream();
```

returnParameters.description:
An array of body parts(`Entity[]`) extracted from the entity body or else a `mime:ParserError` if the
entity body is not a set of the body parts

methods.name: getBodyParts
methods.description:
Gets the body parts from a given entity.
```ballerina
mime:Entity[]|mime:ParserError result = multipartEntity.getBodyParts();
```

parameters.name: arraySize
parameters.description: A defaultable paramerter to state the size of the byte array. Default size is 8KB

returnParameters.description: Body parts as a byte stream

methods.name: getBodyPartsAsStream
methods.description:
Gets the body parts as a byte stream from a given entity.
```ballerina
stream<byte[], io:Error?>|mime:ParserError str = multipartEntity.getBodyPartsAsStream();
```

parameters.name: bodyParts
parameters.description: Body parts, which need to be set to the entity

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Content-type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The default value is `multipart/form-data`.

methods.name: setBodyParts
methods.description:
Sets the body parts to the entity. This method overrides any existing `content-type` headers
with the default `multipart/form-data` content-type. The default `multipart/form-data` value can be overridden
by passing the content type as an optional parameter.
```ballerina
multipartEntity.setBodyParts(bodyParts, contentType);
```

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: Header name

returnParameters.description:
Header value associated with the given header name as a `string`. If multiple header values are
present, then the first value is returned. The `HeaderNotFoundError` is returned if the header is not
found

methods.name: getHeader
methods.description:
Gets the header value associated with the given header name.
```ballerina
string|mime:HeaderNotFoundError headerName = mimeEntity.getHeader(mime:CONTENT_LENGTH);
```

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: Header name

returnParameters.description:
All the header values associated with the given header name as a `string[]` or the
`HeaderNotFoundError` if the header is not found

methods.name: getHeaders
methods.description:
Gets all the header values associated with the given header name.
```ballerina
string[]|mime:HeaderNotFoundError headerNames = mimeEntity.getHeaders(mime:CONTENT_TYPE);
```

returnParameters.description: All header names as a `string[]`

methods.name: getHeaderNames
methods.description:
Gets all the header names.
```ballerina
string[] headerNames = mimeEntity.getHeaderNames();
```

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: Header name

parameters.name: headerValue
parameters.description: The header value to be added

methods.name: addHeader
methods.description:
Adds the given header value against the given header. Panic if an illegal header is passed.
```ballerina
mimeEntity.addHeader("custom-header", "header-value");
```

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: Header name

parameters.name: headerValue
parameters.description: Header value

methods.name: setHeader
methods.description:
Sets the given header value against the existing header. If a header already exists, its value is replaced
with the given header value. Panic if an illegal header is passed.
```ballerina
mimeEntity.setHeader("custom-header", "header-value");
```

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: Header name

methods.name: removeHeader
methods.description:
Removes the given header from the entity.
```ballerina
mimeEntity.removeHeader("custom-header");
```

methods.name: removeAllHeaders
methods.description:
Removes all headers associated with the entity.
```ballerina
mimeEntity.removeAllHeaders();
```

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: Header name

returnParameters.description: `true` if the specified header key exists

methods.name: hasHeader
methods.description:
Checks whether the requested header key exists in the header map.
```ballerina
boolean res = mimeEntity.hasHeader("custom-header");
```

classes.name: Entity
classes.description:
Represents the headers and body of a message. This can be used to represent both the entity of a top level message
and an entity(body part) inside of a multipart entity.

fields.name: primaryType
fields.description: Declares the general type of data

fields.name: subType
fields.description: A specific format of the primary-type data

fields.name: suffix
fields.description: Identifies the semantics of a specific media type

fields.name: parameters
fields.description: A set of parameters specified in an `attribute=value` notation

returnParameters.description: Base type as a `string` from the `MediaType` struct

methods.name: getBaseType
methods.description:
Gets the primaryType/subtype+suffix combination in a `string` format.
```ballerina
string baseType = mediaType.getBaseType();
```

returnParameters.description: Content type with parameters as a `string`

methods.name: toString
methods.description:
Converts the media type to a `string`, which is suitable to be used as the value of a corresponding HTTP header.
```ballerina
string mediaTypeString = mediaType.toString();
```

returnParameters.description: Base type as a `string` from the `MediaType` struct

otherMethods.name: getBaseType
otherMethods.description:
Gets the primaryType/subtype+suffix combination in a `string` format.
```ballerina
string baseType = mediaType.getBaseType();
```

returnParameters.description: Content type with parameters as a `string`

otherMethods.name: toString
otherMethods.description:
Converts the media type to a `string`, which is suitable to be used as the value of a corresponding HTTP header.
```ballerina
string mediaTypeString = mediaType.toString();
```

classes.name: MediaType
classes.description: Describes the nature of the data in the body of a MIME entity.

parameters.name: contentToBeDecoded
parameters.description: Content that needs to be decoded can be of type `string`, `byte[]` or `io:ReadableByteChannel`

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: Charset to be used. This is used only with the string input

returnParameters.description:
A decoded `string` if the given input is of type string, a decoded `byte[]` if the given input is of
type byte[], a decoded `io:ReadableByteChannel` if the given input is of type io:ReadableByteChannel
or else a `mime:DecodeError` in case of errors

functions.name: base64Decode
functions.description: **Deprecated API**. Decodes a given input with MIME specific Base64 encoding scheme.

parameters.name: valueToBeDecoded
parameters.description: Content, which needs to be decoded

returnParameters.description: A decoded `byte[]` or else a `mime:DecodeError` record in case of errors

functions.name: base64DecodeBlob
functions.description: **Deprecated API**. Decodes a given byte[] using the Base64 encoding scheme.

parameters.name: contentToBeEncoded
parameters.description: Content that needs to be encoded can be of type `string`, `byte[]` or `io:ReadableByteChannel`

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: Charset to be used. This is used only with the string input

returnParameters.description:
An encoded `string` if the given input is of type string, an encoded `byte[]` if the given input is of
type byte[], an encoded `io:ReadableByteChannel` if the given input is of type `io:ReadableByteChannel`,
or else a `mime:EncodeError` record in case of errors

functions.name: base64Encode
functions.description: **Deprecated API**. Encodes a given input with MIME specific Base64 encoding scheme.

parameters.name: valueToBeEncoded
parameters.description: Content, which needs to be encoded

returnParameters.description: An encoded byte[] or else a `mime:EncodeError` record in case of errors

functions.name: base64EncodeBlob
functions.description: **Deprecated API**. Encodes a given byte[] using the Base64 encoding scheme.

parameters.name: contentDisposition
parameters.description: Content disposition string

returnParameters.description: A `ContentDisposition` object

functions.name: getContentDispositionObject
functions.description:
Given the Content-Disposition as a string, gets the `ContentDisposition` object with it.
```ballerina
mime:ContentDisposition cDisposition = getContentDispositionObject("form-data; name=filepart; filename=file-01.txt");
```

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: Content-Type in string

returnParameters.description: `MediaType` object or else a `mime:InvalidContentTypeError` in case of an invalid content-type

functions.name: getMediaType
functions.description:
Gets the `MediaType` object populated with it when the `Content-Type` is in string.
```ballerina
mime:MediaType|mime:InvalidContentTypeError returnVal = getMediaType("custom-header");
```

constants.name: BOUNDARY
constants.description: Key name for `boundary` parameter in MediaType. This is needed for composite type media types.

constants.name: CHARSET
constants.description: Key name for `charset` parameter in MediaType. This indicates the character set of the body text.

constants.name: DEFAULT_CHARSET
constants.description: Default charset to be used with MIME encoding and decoding.

constants.name: START
constants.description:
Key name for `start` parameter in MediaType. This determines which part in the multipart message contains the
payload.

constants.name: TYPE
constants.description: Key name for `type` parameter in MediaType. This indicates the MIME media type of the `root` body part.

modules.summary: This module provides a set of APIs to work with messages, which follow the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions
modules.description:
## Overview

This module provides a set of APIs to work with messages, which follow the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions 
(MIME) specification as specified in the [RFC 2045 standard](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2045.txt).

> Entity refers to the header fields and the content of a message or a part of the body in a multipart entity. 

### Supported multipart types

The module supports `multipart/form-data`, `multipart/mixed`, `multipart/alternative`, `multipart/related`, and 
`multipart/parallel` as multipart content types.

### Modify and retrieve the data in an entity

This module provides functions to set and get an entity body from different kinds of message types such as XML, text, 
JSON, byte[], and body parts. Headers can be modified through functions such as `addHeader()`, `setHeader()`, 
`removeHeader()`, etc. 

### Handling large files

The entity object method `setFileAsEntityBody()` can be used to set large files as the entity body and 
is able to read it as a stream using the `getByteStream()` function.
This module provides a set of APIs to work with messages, which follow the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions

classes.description:
Represents the headers and body of a message. This can be used to represent both the entity of a top level message
and an entity(body part) inside of a multipart entity.
Describes the nature of the data in the body of a MIME entity.

functions.description: **Deprecated API**. Decodes a given input with MIME specific Base64 encoding scheme.
**Deprecated API**. Decodes a given byte[] using the Base64 encoding scheme.
**Deprecated API**. Encodes a given input with MIME specific Base64 encoding scheme.
**Deprecated API**. Encodes a given byte[] using the Base64 encoding scheme.

Given the Content-Disposition as a string, gets the `ContentDisposition` object with it.
```ballerina
mime:ContentDisposition cDisposition = getContentDispositionObject("form-data; name=filepart; filename=file-01.txt");
```

Gets the `MediaType` object populated with it when the `Content-Type` is in string.
```ballerina
mime:MediaType|mime:InvalidContentTypeError returnVal = getMediaType("custom-header");
```

constants.description: Key name for `boundary` parameter in MediaType. This is needed for composite type media types.
Key name for `charset` parameter in MediaType. This indicates the character set of the body text.
Default charset to be used with MIME encoding and decoding.

Key name for `start` parameter in MediaType. This determines which part in the multipart message contains the
payload.
Key name for `type` parameter in MediaType. This indicates the MIME media type of the `root` body part.
